thread.title: This Army command post banned ‘Nickelback and other terrible rock groups’ and we’ve never felt more patriotic
thread.title_full: This Army command post banned ‘Nickelback and other terrible rock groups’ and we’ve never felt more patriotic

author: Baby Mac
title: This Army command post banned ‘Nickelback and other terrible rock groups’ and we’ve never felt more patriotic
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
The widely-hated Canadian band Nickelback can’t get any breaks. Just days after Arnold Schwarzenegger threw the group under the bus , an officer in the U.S. Army banned playing Nickelback and other “terrible ‘rock groups'” in the command post. The music—if you can call the sound of Nickelback music—is banned at “all times, not just work hours.” 2 
In the memo shared on Twitter , the officer also called out Slipknot, Korn, Creed, and even Smashmouth, which is probably at least a little unfair to the all-star band. 
Overall though, we love the display of leadership—that’s exactly what our nation needs. 3
